sec.p: The base of this zone marks the boundary between the silty clays (Unit 2d) and the organic beds (Units 3 and 4). Mesohalobous and halophilous diatoms expand in frequency to >75% of the total assemblage, dominated by the rapid rise of Actinocyclus normanii (Greg.) Hust., which reaches >80%. At the base of the zone, marine taxa, dominated by P. sulcata and Th. excentrica, rise to maximum values (ca 55%), before falling to ca 12% at the top of the zone. Freshwater diatoms show low, erratic frequencies and are dominated by the return of Fragilaria spp. to values of ca 8%.
